basic.description:
Advanced study of the component parts of the complex process of drug discovery and development and the assessment of human toxicology including drug delivery and formulation, directed toxicology studies, drug disposition, clinical trials, legal issues and regulatory approval. 
NOTE    Priority given to students in the LISC Specialization, DDHT Sub-Plan.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (12L;24G;84P)
basic.subject: DDHT
basic.title: Principles of Drug Development

extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE    DDHT 459/3.0 and PHAR 416/3.0 and registration in a LISC Major or Specialization Plan and (a GPA of 2.5) or permission of the instructor.
